claims: The first large-scale desalination plant was built in 1930.

The first large-scale desalination plant: When was the first large-scale desalination plant built? First large-scale desalination plant 1930

In 1869, the first sea water distillation plant was built by the British government in Aden (Yemen) to supply the ships of the Empire with fresh water en route to India. The first large-scale desalination plant was built in 1930 at Aruba, in the Netherlands Antilles, near Venezuela.
When was the first large-scale desalination plant built? First large-scale desalination plant 1930

The first large-scale desalination plant was built in 1930 at Aruba, in the Netherlands Antilles, near Venezuela. In the 1950s, distillation was the only viable means of desalination of either brackish or sea water.
Where was the first large-scale desalination plant built? First large-scale desalination plant Aruba
